availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Whitley County, Kentucky, physician. Washington County, Vermont native. Son of Orson and Dorothea Skinner. Married to Sarah P. Clark on October 5, 1851. Father of Jennie M. Skinner, Julia M. Skinner, Elvira E. Skinner, and Mary E. Skinner. Appointed Postmaster in Russell County, Kentucky in 1848. Lawyer in Russell County, Kentucky in 1850. Lawyer in Whitley County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Russell County, District One. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Whitley County, District One, p. 107. William G. Cutler, History of the State of Kansas (Chicago: A.T. Andreas, 1883), http://www.kancoll.org/books/cutler/woodson/woodson-co-p4.html#BIOGRAPHICALSKETCHESSKINNER-WILSON (accessed April 26, 2018). Find A Grave, “Dr J. O. W. ‘OJ’ Skinner (1817-1893),” Memorial #22570960, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22570960/j.-o._w.-skinner# (accessed April 26, 2018).
